item.title: I'm Not Dead Yet!
item.content:encoded:
The last several months have been quite eventful for me, and this poor excuse for a blog has been low on my list of priorities -- but no longer!. Well, maybe it's moved up a notch or two.

I will probably continue my declare 'MelonJS' articles soon, but for now I am on to other things.

First up is my ludum dare #23 entry, a text adventure called 'The Tiny World'. It's not fancy, and it's built from scratch (I know, I know -- I probably should have just gone with inform7). Play it if you like, it's probably mediocre at best!

Second up, my new job is a lot about Python and, more specifically, Plone, so expect to see some posts on those things.

item.title: Updates
item.content:encoded:
I Decided to sit down and design a new theme, which is still rough and in development.

I also decided it was time to move my website over to github. This is for a couple of reasons... so I don't have all my eggs in one basket (Google), and so I don't have to do as much maintenance.

Basically the appengine tools are tools that I only use for updating my website/blog. Why not replace those tools with a single tool that I use for other stuff to?

Now I just need to use git, which I don't have to manually update and setup since it's in my OS's package repositories! Woohoo, less work for me!
